thinking.disposable_income: North Center is an affluent area with median household income around $110,000, significantly above Chicago's average. Residents have relatively high disposable income and can generally afford higher transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Area has high discretionary spending power, with many residents spending on dining, entertainment, and retail. Higher sales tax would have moderate impact but not severely constrain spending habits
thinking.accessibility: Well-served by Brown Line, multiple bus routes, and major arterial roads. 71% of residents commute by car, 21% by transit. Area has good transportation options and infrastructure for both modes
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Given high income levels, prioritize time savings over cost savings. 2. Support policies that improve both transit and driving times since area uses both modes significantly. 3. Can absorb higher taxes/fees for better service. 4. Higher driver fees acceptable to reduce congestion. 5. Moderate transit fares to maintain ridership. Selected policies balance service improvements with reasonable cost increases, focusing on proposals with 1.0-1.5% tax rates that generate revenue for system improvements while maintaining affordability
